For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the Chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website. 

We will provide updates as necessary.
Passengers are advised to check the travel requirements, safety protocols, and frequently asked questions (FAQs) on the CEB website: https://t.co/lBwTdCK3yJ
Guests must manage their flight booking online via https://t.co/GAB2WonRbR up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure.

2. Travel Fund 
Store the amount in a virtual CEB wallet valid for six (6) months and use this to either book a new flight or pay for add-ons (example: baggage allowance, seat selection, etc.)

Here are the options: 

1. Rebook 
Rebook without fare difference for travel up to thirty (30) days from original flight date. Fare difference will apply if travel period is beyond thirty (30) days from original flight date.
Cebu Pacific is also offering options for passengers of flights touching Naga and Legazpi from June 13- 14, 2022, to give guests peace of mind and additional flexibility.

3. Refund   
The process may take up to two (2) months from the date of request.

2. Travel Fund   
Store the amount in a virtual CEB wallet valid for six (6) months and use this to either book a new flight or pay for add-ons (example: baggage allowance, seat selection, etc.)

1. Rebook   
Rebook without fare difference for travel up to thirty (30) days from original flight date. Fare difference will apply if travel period is beyond thirty (30) days from original flight date.
Affected passengers may conveniently avail any of the following options online, through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website:

5J327/328 Manila – Legazpi – Manila 
DG6195/6196 Manila – Legazpi – Manila 
DG6111/6112 Manila – Naga - Manila 
DG6117/6118 Manila – Naga – Manila

Cebu Pacific Advisory #2 
Cancelled flights due to Mt. Bulusan eruption 
As of June 12, 2022; 4:45pm 

Due to the volcanic activity by Mt. Bulusan which spewed ash, the following Cebu Pacific and Cebgo flights on June 12 are cancelled: 

5J325/326 Manila – Legazpi – Manila

1. Rebook   
Rebook for travel within 30 days at no additional cost, following CEB’s permanent removal of change fees. Fare difference waived.
https://t.co/ZVdqe7LlOK

For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the Chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website. 

We will provide updates as necessary.

3. Refund   
The process may take up to two (2) months from the date of request.     

Passengers are advised to check the travel requirements, safety protocols, and frequently asked questions (FAQs) on the CEB website: https://t.co/lBwTdCK3yJ

2. Travel Fund   
Store the amount in a virtual CEB wallet valid for six (6) months and use this to either book a new flight or pay for add-ons (example: baggage allowance, seat selection, etc.)

5J327/328 Manila – Legazpi – Manila 

DG6111/6112 Manila – Naga - Manila 

DG6117/6118 Manila – Naga – Manila 

Affected passengers may conveniently avail any of the following options online, through https://t.co/PYPckoiVst on the Cebu Pacific website:

Captain Sam Avila
VP-Flight Operations
Cebu Pacific Air

Cebu Pacific has very strict social media policies covering all of its employees and such a post should not have been published. This is recognized by the said pilot himself. He is currently under disciplinary review in accordance with our Company rules and standards.

public for the actions of our pilot. As professional aviators and free citizens of this country, we are free to express opinions, but we are also expected to carry out our roles and duties with utmost discernment and caution.

speculative and careless on his part. While the pilot posted his commentary on his own accord, a post he has since removed, on behalf of Cebu Pacific, and as Head of our Pilot Group, I take command responsibility and apologize unreservedly to the Vice President and the general

STATEMENT ON SOCIAL MEDIA POST BY A CEBU PACIFIC PILOT

Since becoming aware of the social media post by one of our pilots in reference to a flight of Vice President Leni Robredo, I confirm that the pilot has made it clear to us that he had no basis for his claim and was purely https://t.co/9pT2GE8CR2

We also have a robust Social Media Policy which has clear guidelines on how our employees should behave on social media because they are stewards of our brand and everything that we value as a company.

Cebu Pacific respects freedom of speech and expression and does not prevent its employees from having or expressing their own political beliefs. However, as a Company, we are also governed by the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and our Company’s Code of Discipline.
